verses.verse: After <S%H310><s%> this opened <S%H6605><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and cursed <S%H7043><s%> his day <S%H3117><s%>.
And Job <S%H347><s%> spake <S%H6030><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, spake: Heb. answered

Let the day <S%H3117><s%> perish <S%H6><s%> wherein I was born <S%H3205><s%>, and the night <S%H3915><s%> in which it was said <S%H559><s%>, There is a man child <S%H1397><s%> conceived <S%H2029><s%>.
Let that day <S%H3117><s%> be darkness <S%H2822><s%>; let not God <S%H433><s%> regard <S%H1875><s%> it from above <S%H4605><s%>, neither let the light <S%H5105><s%> shine <S%H3313><s%> upon it.

Let darkness <S%H2822><s%> and the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%> stain <S%H1350><s%> it; let a cloud <S%H6053><s%> dwell <S%H7931><s%> upon it; let the blackness <S%H3650><s%> of the day <S%H3117><s%> terrify <S%H1204><s%> it. stain: or, challenge let the: or, let them terrify it, as those who have a bitter day

As for that night <S%H3915><s%>, let darkness <S%H652><s%> seize <S%H3947><s%> upon it; let it not be joined <S%H2302><s%> unto the days <S%H3117><s%> of the year <S%H8141><s%>, let it not come <S%H935><s%> into the number <S%H4557><s%> of the months <S%H3391><s%>. let it not be: or, let it not rejoice among the days
Lo, let that night <S%H3915><s%> be solitary <S%H1565><s%>, let no joyful voice <S%H7445><s%> come <S%H935><s%> therein.
Let them curse <S%H5344><s%> it that curse <S%H779><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%>, who are ready <S%H6264><s%> to raise up <S%H5782><s%> their mourning <S%H3882><s%>. their: or, leviathan

Let the stars <S%H3556><s%> of the twilight <S%H5399><s%> thereof be dark <S%H2821><s%>; let it look <S%H6960><s%> for light <S%H216><s%>, but have none; neither let it see <S%H7200><s%> the dawning <S%H6079><s%> of the day <S%H7837><s%>: the dawning: Heb. the eyelids of the morning
Because it shut not up <S%H5462><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of my mother's womb <S%H990><s%>, nor hid <S%H5641><s%> sorrow <S%H5999><s%> from mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>.
Why died <S%H4191><s%> I not from the womb <S%H7358><s%>? why did I not give up the ghost <S%H1478><s%> when I came out <S%H3318><s%> of the belly <S%H990><s%>?
Why did the knees <S%H1290><s%> prevent <S%H6923><s%> me? or why the breasts <S%H7699><s%> that I should suck <S%H3243><s%>?
For now should I have lain still <S%H7901><s%> and been quiet <S%H8252><s%>, I should have slept <S%H3462><s%>: then had I been at rest <S%H5117><s%>,
With kings <S%H4428><s%> and counsellors <S%H3289><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>, which built <S%H1129><s%> desolate places <S%H2723><s%> for themselves;
Or with princes <S%H8269><s%> that had gold <S%H2091><s%>, who filled <S%H4390><s%> their houses <S%H1004><s%> with silver <S%H3701><s%>:
Or as an hidden <S%H2934><s%> untimely birth <S%H5309><s%> I had not been; as infants <S%H5768><s%> which never saw <S%H7200><s%> light <S%H216><s%>.
There the wicked <S%H7563><s%> cease <S%H2308><s%> from troubling <S%H7267><s%>; and there the weary <S%H3019><s%> <S%H3581><s%> be at rest <S%H5117><s%>. weary: Heb. wearied in strength
There the prisoners <S%H615><s%> rest <S%H7599><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>; they hear <S%H8085><s%> not the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the oppressor <S%H5065><s%>.
The small <S%H6996><s%> and great <S%H1419><s%> are there; and the servant <S%H5650><s%> is free <S%H2670><s%> from his master <S%H113><s%>.
Wherefore is light <S%H216><s%> given <S%H5414><s%> to him that is in misery <S%H6001><s%>, and life <S%H2416><s%> unto the bitter <S%H4751><s%> in soul <S%H5315><s%>;
Which long <S%H2442><s%> for death <S%H4194><s%>, but it cometh not; and dig <S%H2658><s%> for it more than for hid treasures <S%H4301><s%>; long: Heb. wait
Which rejoice <S%H8056><s%> exceedingly <S%H1524><s%>, and are glad <S%H7797><s%>, when they can find <S%H4672><s%> the grave <S%H6913><s%>?
Why is light given to a man <S%H1397><s%> whose way <S%H1870><s%> is hid <S%H5641><s%>, and whom God <S%H433><s%> hath hedged in <S%H5526><s%>?
For my sighing <S%H585><s%> cometh <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> I eat <S%H3899><s%>, and my roarings <S%H7581><s%> are poured out <S%H5413><s%> like the waters <S%H4325><s%>. I eat: Heb. my meat

For the thing which I greatly <S%H6343><s%> feared <S%H6342><s%> is come <S%H857><s%> upon me, and that which I was afraid <S%H3025><s%> of is come <S%H935><s%> unto me. the thing: Heb. I feared a fear, and it came upon me
I was not in safety <S%H7951><s%>, neither had I rest <S%H8252><s%>, neither was I quiet <S%H5117><s%>; yet trouble <S%H7267><s%> came <S%H935><s%>.
